The Earth's orbit would be elliptical, and the Earth would be closer to the sun at one point in its orbit than it is now.
The Earth would have more extreme seasons, with very hot summers and very cold winters.
The Earth's tides would be much stronger, and they would occur more often.
The Earth's day and night cycle would be much shorter, with only a few hours of daylight and darkness.
The Earth's atmosphere would be much thinner, and the air would be much colder.
